page.title: 17NAIRN:NURSERIES
page.content: The Lodgehill nurseries were formed in 1885.They are situated at the west end of the Lodgehill area of Nairn.The former owner,Mr Ferguson,sold it to Mr B.P.Williamson in winter 1980.Since then the Nurseries have thrived,tended by the five staff employed by Mr Williamson. The Nurseries serve about 100 customers daily.The customers can buy a variety of crops and garden products.The most popular type of plant are the bedding plants. Although pressed for space,the owners have managed to fit in 7 greenhouses and their own house.They also have four acres of fields full of plants and vegetables,eg.potatoes, carrots and turnips.The main problem is the freezing winters which may kill certain plants.
